                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Effect of holding over

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    116. If a lessee or under-lessee of property remains in possession thereof after the determination of the lease granted to the lessee, and the lessor or his legal representative accepts rent from the lessee or under-lessee, or otherwise assents to his continuing in possession, the lease is, in the absence of an agreement to the contrary, renewed from year to year, or from month to month, according to the purpose for which the property is leased, as specified in section 106.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Illustrations	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) A lets a house to B for five years. B underlets the house to C at a monthly rent of Tk. 100. The five years expire, but C continues in possession of the house and pays the rent to A. C's lease is renewed from month to month.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> (b) A lets a farm to B for the life of C. C dies, but B continues in possession with A's assent. B's lease is renewed from year to year.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Exemption of leases for agricultural purposes

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    117. None of the provisions of this Chapter apply to leases for agricultural purposes, except in so far as the Government may, by notification published in the official Gazette, declare all or any of such provisions to be so applicable in the case of all or any of such leases, together with, or subject to, those of the local law, if any, for the time being in force.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Such notification shall not take effect until the expiry of six months from the date of its publication.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter VI

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                OF EXCHANGES

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	â€œExchangeâ€ defined

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    118. When two persons mutually transfer the ownership of one thing for the ownership of another, neither thing or both things being money only, the transaction is called an â€œexchangeâ€.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>A transfer of property in completion of an exchange can be made only in manner provided of the transfer of such property by sale. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Right of party deprived of thing received in exchange

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    119. If any party to an exchange or any person claiming through or under such party is by reason of any defect in the title of the other party deprived of the thing or any part of the thing received by him in exchange, then, unless a contrary intention appears from the terms of the exchange, such other party is liable to him or any person claiming through or under him for loss caused thereby, or at the option of the person so deprived, for the return of the thing transferred, if still in the possession of such other party or his legal representative or a transferee from him without consideration. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Rights and liabilities of parties

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    120. Save as otherwise provided in this Chapter, each party has the rights and is subject to the liabilities of a seller as to that which he gives, and has the rights and is subject to the liabilities of a buyer as to that which he takes. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Exchange of money

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    121. On an exchange of money, each party thereby warrants the genuineness of the money given by him. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter VII

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                OF GIFTS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	â€œGiftâ€ defined	

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    122. â€œGiftâ€ is the transfer of certain existing moveable or immoveable property made voluntarily and without consideration, by one person, called the donor, to another, called the donee, and accepted by or on behalf of the donee.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Acceptance when to be made

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    Such acceptance must be made during the lifetime of the donor and while he is still capable of giving.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>If the donee dies before acceptance, the gift is void.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Transfer how effected

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    123. For the purpose of making a gift of immoveable property, the transfer must be effected by a registered instrument signed by or on behalf of the donor, and attested by at least two witnesses.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='New paragraph was inserted by section 7 of the Transfer of Property (Amendment) Act, 2004 (Act No. XXVI of 2004)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >32</a></sup></span></span>[Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, a heba under Muhammadan law shall be deemed to be a gift of immoveable property for the aforesaid purpose.]<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>For the purpose of making a gift of moveable property, the transfer may be effected either by a registered instrument signed as aforesaid or by delivery.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Such delivery may be made in the same way as goods sold may be delivered

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Gift of existing and future property

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    124. A gift comprising both existing and future property is void as to the latter. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Gift to several of whom one does not accept

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    125. A gift of a thing to two or more donees, of whom one does not accept it, is void as to the interest which he would have taken had he accepted. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	When gift may be suspended or revoked

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    126. The donor and donee may agree that on the happening of any specified event which does not depend on the will of the donor a gift shall be suspended or revoked; but a gift which the parties agree shall be revocable wholly or in part, at the mere will of the donor, is void wholly or in part, as the case may be.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>A gift may also be revoked in any of the cases (save want or failure of consideration) in which, if it were a contract, it might be rescinded.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Save as aforesaid, a gift cannot be revoked.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Nothing contained in this section shall be deemed to affect the rights of transferees for consideration without notice.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Illustrations<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) A gives a field to B, reserving to himself, with B's assent, the right to take back the field in case B and his descendants die before A. B dies without descendants in A's lifetime. A may take back the field.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> (b) A gives a lakh of Tk. to B, reserving to himself, with B's assent, the right to take back at pleasure Tk. 10,000, out of the lakh. The gift holds goods as to Tk. 90,000, but is void as to Tk. 10,000, which continue to belong to A. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Onerous gifts.	Onerous gift to disqualified person.

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    127. Where a gift is in the form of a single transfer to the same person of several things of which one is, and the others are not, burden by an obligation, the donee can take nothing by the gift unless he accepts it fully.		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Where a gift is in the form of two or more separate and independent transfers to the same person of several things, the donee is at liberty to accept one of them and refuse the others, although the former may be beneficial and the latter onerous.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Onerous gift to disqualified person

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    A donee not competent to contract and accepting property burdened by any obligation is not bound by his acceptance. But if, after becoming competent to contract and being aware of the obligation, he retains the property given, he becomes so bound.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Illustrations	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) A has shares in X, a prosperous joint stock company, and also shares in Y, a joint stock company, in difficulties. Heavy calls are expected in respect of the shares in Y. A gives B all his shares in joint stock companies. B refuses to accept the shares in Y. He cannot take the shares in X.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> (b) A having a lease for a term of years of a house at a rent which he and his representatives are bound to pay during the term, and which is more than the house can be let for, gives to B the lease, and also, as a separate and independent transaction, a sum of money. B refuses to accept the lease. He does not by this refusal forfeit the money.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>128. Subject to the provisions of section 127, where a gift consists of the donor's whole property, the donee is personally liable for all the debts due by and liabilities of the donor at the time of the gift to the extent of the property comprised therein. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Universal donee

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    128. Subject to the provisions of section 127, where a gift consists of the donor's whole property, the donee is personally liable for all the debts due by and liabilities of the donor at the time of the gift to the extent of the property comprised therein.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Saving of donations mortis causa and Muhammadan law

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    129. Nothing in this Chapter relates to gifts of moveable property made in contemplation of death  <span class='footnote'  title='The comma and words â€œ, or shall be deemed to affect any rule of Muhammadan Lawâ€ were omitted by section 8 of the Transfer of Property (Amendment) Act, 2004 (Act No. XXVI of 2004).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >33</a></sup></span></span>[* * *].

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter VIII

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                OF TRANSFERS OF ACTIONABLE CLAIMS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Transfer of actionable claim

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    130. (1) The transfer of an actionable claim whether with or without consideration shall be effected only by the execution of an instrument in writing signed by the transferor or his duly authorised agent, shall be complete and effectual upon the execution of such instrument, and thereupon all the rights and remedies of the transferor, whether by way of damages or otherwise, shall vest in the transferee, whether such notice of the transfer as is hereinafter provided be given or not:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that every dealing with the debt or other actionable claim by the debtor or other person from or against whom the transferor would, but for such instrument of transfer as aforesaid, have been entitled to recover or enforce such debt or other actionable claim, shall (save where the debtor or other person is a party to the transfer or has received express notice thereof as hereinafter provided) be valid as against such transfer.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The transferee of an actionable claim may, upon the execution of such instrument of transfer as aforesaid, sue or institute proceedings for the same in his own name without obtaining the transferor's consent to such suit or proceedings and without making him a party thereto.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Exception:-Nothing in this section applies to the transfer of a marine or fire policy of insurance or affects the provisions of section 38 of the <a title='Insurance Act, 1938' href='/act-175.html'>Insurance Act, 1938</a>.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Illustrations	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(i) A owes money to B, who transfers the debt to C. B then demands the debt from A, who, not having received notice of the transfer, as prescribed in section 131, pays B. The payment is valid, and C cannot sue A for the debt.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(ii) A effects a policy on his own life with an Insurance Company and assigns it to a Bank for securing the payment of an existing or future debt. If A dies, the Bank is entitled to receive the amount of the policy and to sue on it without the concurrence of A's executor, subject to the proviso in sub-section (1) of section 130 and to the provisions of section 132.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Transfer of policy of marine insurance

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                     <span class='footnote'  title='Section 130A was inserted by section 2 of the Transfer of Property (Amendment) Act, 1944 (Act No. VI of 1944).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >34</a></sup></span></span>[130A. (1) A policy of marine insurance may be transferred by assignment unless it contains terms expressly prohibiting assignment, and may be assigned either before or after loss.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) A policy of marine insurance may be assigned by endorsement thereon or in any other customary manner.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) Where the insured person has parted with or lost his interest in the subject-matter insured, and has not, before or at the time of so doing, expressly or impliedly agreed to assign the policy, any subsequent assignment of the policy is inoperative:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that nothing in this sub-section affects the assignment of the policy after loss.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) Nothing in clause (e) of section 6 shall affect the provisions of this section.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Notice to be in writing, signed

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    131. Every notice of transfer of an actionable claim shall be in writing, signed by the transferor or his agent duly authorised in this behalf, or, in case the transferor refuses to sign, by the transferee or his agent, and shall state the name and address of the transferee. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Liability of transferee of actionable claim

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    132. The transferee of an actionable claim shall take it subject to all the liabilities and equities to which the transferor was subject in respect thereof at the date of the transfer.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Illustrations<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(i) A transfers to C a debt due to him by B, A being then indebted to B. C sues B for the debt due by B to A. In such suit B is entitled to set off the debt due by A to him; although C was unaware of it at the date of such transfer.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(ii) A executed a bond in favour of B under circumstances entitling the former to have it delivered up and cancelled. B assigns the bond to C for value and without notice of such circumstances. C cannot enforce the bond against A. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Warranty of solvency of debtor

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    133. Where the transferor of a debt warrants the solvency of the debtor, the warranty, in the absence of a contract to the contrary, applies only to his solvency at the time of the transfer, and is limited, where the transfer is made for consideration, to the amount or value of such consideration. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Mortgaged debt

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    134. Where a debt is transferred for the purpose of securing an existing or future debt, the debt so transferred, if received by the transferor or recovered by the transferee, is applicable, first, in payment of the costs of such recovery: secondly, in or towards satisfaction of the amount for the time being secured by the transfer; and the residue, if any, belongs to the transferor or other person entitled to receive the same. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Assignment of rights under policy of insurance against fire

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    135. Every assignee by endorsement or other writing, of a policy of insurance against fire, in whom the property in the subject insured shall be absolutely vested at the date of the assignment, shall have transferred and vested in him all rights of suit as if the contract contained in the policy had been made with himself. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Assignment of rights under policy of marine insurance

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                     <span class='footnote'  title='Section 135A was inserted by section 4 of the Transfer of Property (Amendment) Act, 1944 (Act No. VI of 1944)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >35</a></sup></span></span>[135A. (1) Where a policy of marine insurance has been assigned so as to pass the beneficial interest therein, the assignee of the policy is entitled to sue thereon in his own name; and the defendant is entitled to make any defence arising out of the contract which he would have been entitled to make if the action had been brought in the name of the person by or on behalf of whom the policy was effected.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Where the insurer pays for a total loss, either of the whole, or in the case of goods, of any apportionable part, of the subject-matter insured, he thereupon becomes entitled to take over the interest of the insured person in whatever may remain of the subject-matter so paid for, and he is thereby subrogated to all the rights and remedies of the insured person in and in respect of that subject-matter as from the time of the casualty causing the loss.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) Where the insurer pays for a partial loss, he acquires no title to the subjectâ€“matter insured, or such part of it as may remain, but he is thereupon subrogated to all rights and remedies of the insured person as from the time of the casualty causing the loss, in so far as the insured person has been indemnified by such payment for the loss.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) Nothing in clause (e) of section 6 shall affect the provisions of this section.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Incapacity of officers connected with Courts of Justice

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    136. No Judge, legal practitioner or officer connected with any Court of Justice shall buy or traffic in, or stipulate for, or agree to receive any share of, or interest in, any actionable claim, and no Court of Justice shall enforce, at his instance, or at the instance of any person claiming by or through him, any actionable claims, so dealt with by him as aforesaid. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Saving of negotiable instruments, etc.

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    137. Nothing in the foregoing sections of this Chapter applies to stocks, shares or debentures, or to instruments which are for the time being, by law or custom, negotiable, or to any mercantile document of title to goods.		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Explanation.-The expression â€œmercantile document of title to goodsâ€ includes a bill of lading, dock-warrant, warehouse-keeper's certificate, railway receipt, warrant or order for the delivery of goods, and any other document used in the ordinary course of business as proof of the possession or control of goods, or authorizing or purporting to authorise, either by endorsement or by delivery, the possessor of the document to transfer or receive goods thereby represented.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <div class="text-center">
                    <h3>

                        <span class='footnote'   title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words â€œBangladeshâ€, â€œGovernmentâ€ and â€œTk.â€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistanâ€, â€œCentral Governmentâ€ or â€œProvincial Governmentâ€ and â€œRs.â€ respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'>1</sup></span></span>The Transfer of Property Act, 1882 

                        
                        
                    </h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            <h4 style="color: #fff;"> (
                                
                                    
                                    
                                        
                                            
                                            ACT
                                        
                                        NO. IV OF 1882
                                    
                                

                                )
                            </h4>
                        
                    
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="bt-act-section-search ">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-bottom12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <p class="pull-left no-print">

                                                                                 aria-hidden="true"></i></a></p>
                <p class="pull-right print-center publish-date">
                    [ 17th February, 1882   ]
                </p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    
    <section
            class="padding-bottom-20 ">
        <div class="row margin-top-20 ">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12 lineremove">
                <button class="printIco print-only pull-right" onclick="window.print();return false;"
                        style="width: 72px;height: 80px;"><i
                        class="fa fa-print" style="font-size: 40px;"></i></button>
                
                    

                        <div class="row">
                            <div class="col-md-2"></div>
                            <div class="col-md-10 text-center act-role-style">
                                
                                <strong>
                                    <span class='footnote' href='#' title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words â€œBangladeshâ€, â€œGovernmentâ€ and â€œTk.â€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistanâ€, â€œCentral Governmentâ€ or â€œProvincial Governmentâ€ and â€œRs.â€ respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>â™£An Act to amend the law relating to the Transfer of Property by Act of Parties.

                                    
                                    
                                </strong>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="row">
                            
                            
                            
                                <div class="col-md-2">&nbsp;&nbsp;Preamble</div>
                            

                            <div class="col-md-10">

                                
                                <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>WHEREAS it is expedient to define and amend certain parts of the law relating to the transfer of property by act of parties; It is hereby enacted as follows:- <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>    <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

                                
                                
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    
                    
                    
                
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="padding-bottom-20 bg-striped ">
        
        
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® I

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                PRELIMINARY

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Short title

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    1.  This Act may be called the <a title='Transfer of Property Act, 1882' href='/act-48.html'>Transfer of Property Act, 1882</a>.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Commencement

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    It shall come into force on the first day of July, 1882.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Extent

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                     <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œIt extends to the whole of Bangladeshâ€ were substituted, for the third, fourth, fifth, sixth and seventh paragraphs by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >3</a></sup></span></span>[It extends to the whole of Bangladesh.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Repeal of Acts	Saving of certain enactments, incidents, rights, liabilities, etc.

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    2.  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œNothing herein contained shall be deemed to affectâ€ were substituted, for the first paragraph by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >4</a></sup></span></span>[Nothing herein contained shall be deemed to affect]-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) 	the provisions of any enactment not hereby expressly repealed:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b) 	any terms or incidents of any contract or constitution of property which are consistent with the provisions of this Act, and are allowed by the law for the time being in force:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c) 	any right or liability arising out of a legal relation constituted before this Act comes into force, or any relief in respect of any such right or liability: or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d) 	save as provided by section 57 and Chapter IV of this Act, any transfer by operation of law or by, or in execution of, a decree or order of a Court of competent jurisdiction:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and nothing in the second chapter of this Act shall be deemed to affect any rule of  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œMuslimâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œMuhammadanâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >5</a></sup></span></span>[Muslim] law.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Interpretation-clause

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    3. In this Act, unless there is something repugnant in the subject or context,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>â€œimmoveable propertyâ€ does not include standing timber, growing crops or grass:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>â€œinstrumentâ€ means a non-testamentary instrument:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>â€œattestedâ€, in relation to an instrument, means and shall be deemed always to have meant attested by two or more witnesses each of whom has seen the executant sign or affix his mark to the instrument, or has seen some other person sign the instrument in the presence and by the direction of the executant, or has received from the executant a personal acknowledgement of his signature or mark, or of the signature of such other person, and each of whom has signed the instrument in the presence of the executant; but it shall not be necessary that more than one of such witnesses shall have been present at the same time, and no particular form of attestation shall be necessary:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>â€œregisteredâ€ means registered in  <span class='footnote'  title='The word "Bangladesh" was substituted, for the words "a Province" by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >6</a></sup></span></span>[Bangladesh] under the law for the time being in force regulating the registration of documents:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	â€œattached to the earthâ€ means-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	(a) 	rooted in the earth, as in the case of trees and shrubs;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b) 	imbedded in the earth, as in the case of walls or buildings; or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> (c) attached to what is so imbedded for the permanent beneficial enjoyment of that to which it is attached:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	â€œActionable claimâ€ means a claim to any debt, other than a debt secured by mortgage of immoveable property or by hypothecation or pledge of moveable property, or to any beneficial interest in moveable property not in the possession, either actual or constructive, of the claimant, which the Civil Courts recognize as affording grounds for relief, whether such debt or beneficial interest be existent, accruing, conditional or contingent:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	â€œa person is said to have noticeâ€ of a fact when he actually knows that fact, or when, but for wilful abstention from an inquiry or search which he ought to have made, or gross negligence, he would have known it.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	Explanation I.-Where any transaction relating to immoveable property is required by law to be and has been effected by a registered instrument, any person acquiring such property or any part of, or share or interest in, such property shall be deemed to have notice of such instrument as from the date of registration or, where the property is not all situated in one sub-district, or where the registered instrument has been registered under sub-section (2) of section 30 of the <a title='Registration Act, 1908' href='/act-90.html'>Registration Act, 1908</a>, from the earliest date on which any memorandum of such registered instrument has been filed by any Sub-Registrar within whose sub-district any part of the property which is being acquired, or of the property wherein a share or interest is being acquired, is situated;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1)	the instrument has been registered and its registration completed in the manner prescribed by the <a title='Registration Act, 1908' href='/act-90.html'>Registration Act, 1908</a>, and the rules made thereunder,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2)	the instrument or memorandum has been duly entered or filed, as the case may be, in books kept under section 51 of that Act, and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3)	the particulars regarding the transaction to which instrument relates have been correctly entered in the indexes kept under section 55 of that Act.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Explanation II.-Any person acquiring any immoveable property or any share or interest in any such property shall be deemed to have notice of the title, if any, of any person who is for the time being in actual possession thereof.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Explanation III.-A person shall be deemed to have had notice of any fact if his agent acquires notice thereof whilst acting on his behalf in the course of business to which that fact is material:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that, if the agent fraudulently conceals the fact, the principal shall not be charged with notice thereof as against any person who was a party to or otherwise cognizant of the fraud.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Enactments relating to contracts to be taken as part of contract Act

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    4. The chapters and sections of this Act which relate to contracts shall be taken as part of the <a title='Contract Act, 1872' href='/act-26.html'>Contract Act, 1872</a>.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>And sections 54, paragraphs 2 and 3, 59, 107 and 123 shall be read as supplement to the <a title='Registration Act, 1908' href='/act-90.html'>Registration Act, 1908</a>. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® II

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                OF TRANSFERS OF PROPERTY BY ACT OF PARTIES

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            (A) Transfer of Property, whether moveable or immoveable

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	â€œTransfer of propertyâ€ defined

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    5. In the following sections â€œtransfer of propertyâ€ means an act by which a living person conveys property, in present or in future, to one or more other living persons, or to himself, or to himself and one or more other living persons; and â€œto transfer propertyâ€ is to perform such act.In this section â€œliving personâ€ includes a company or associations or body of individuals, whether incorporated or not, but nothing herein contained shall affect any law for the time being in force relating to transfer of property to or by companies, associations or bodies of individuals. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	What may be transferred

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    6. Property of any kind may be transferred, except as otherwise provided by this Act or by any other law for the time being in force.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) The chance of an heir-apparent succeeding to an estate, the chance of a relation obtaining a legacy on the death of a kinsman, or any other mere possibility of a like nature, cannot be transferred.<div
