            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    90. [Repealed by section 156 and Schedule V of the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a> (Act No. V of 1908).]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            Redemption

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Person who  may sue for redemption

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    91. Besides the mortgagor, any of the following persons may redeem, or institute a suit for redemption of, the mortgaged property, namely:-		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	any person (other than the mortgagee of the interest sought to be redeemed) who has any interest in, or charge upon, the property mortgaged or in or upon the right to redeem the same;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	any surety for the payment of the mortgage-debt or any part thereof; or 		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	any creditor of the mortgagor who has in a suit for the administration of his estate obtained a decree for sale of the mortgaged property.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Subrogation

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    92. Any of the persons referred to in section 91 (other than the mortgagor) and any co-mortgagor shall, on redeeming property subject to the mortgage, have, so far as regards redemption, foreclosure or sale of such property, the same rights as the mortgagee whose mortgage he redeems may have against the mortgagor or any other mortgagee.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>The right conferred by this section is called the right of subrogation, and a person acquiring the same is said to be subrogated to the rights of the mortgagee whose mortgage he redeems.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>A person who has advanced to a mortgagor money with which the mortgage has been redeemed shall be subrogated to the rights of the mortgagee whose mortgage has been redeemed, if the mortgagor has by a registered instrument agreed that such persons shall be so subrogated.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Nothing in this section shall be deemed to confer a right of subrogation on any person unless the mortgage in respect of which the right is claimed has been redeemed in full. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Prohibition of tacking

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    93. No mortgagee paying off a prior mortgage, whether with or without notice of an intermediate mortgage, shall thereby acquire any priority in respect of his original security; and, except in the case provided for by section 79, no mortgagee making a subsequent advance to the mortgagor, whether with or without notice of an intermediate mortgage, shall thereby acquire any priority in respect of his security for such subsequent advance. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Rights of mesne mortgagee

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    94. Where a property is mortgaged for successive debts to successive mortgagees, a mesne mortgage has the same rights against mortgagees posterior to himself as he has against the mortgagor. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Right of redeeming co-mortgagor to expenses

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    95. Where one of several mortgagors redeems the mortgaged property, he shall, in enforcing his right of subrogation under section 92 against his co-mortgagors, be entitled to add to the mortgage-money recoverable from them such proportion of the expenses properly incurred in such redemption as is attributable to their share in the property. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Mortgage by deposit of title-deeds

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    96. The provisions hereinbefore contained which apply to a simple mortgage shall, so far as may be, apply to a mortgage by deposit of title-deeds. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    97. [Repealed by section 156 and Schedule V of the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a> (Act No. V of 1908).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            Anomalous Mortgages

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Rights and liabilities of parties to anomalous mortgages

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    98. In the case of an anomalous mortgage the rights and liabilities of the parties shall be determined by their contract as evidenced in the mortgage-deed, and, so far as such contract does not extend, by local usage. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    99. [Repealed by section 156 and Schedule V of the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a> (Act No. V of 1908).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            Charges

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Charges

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    100. Where immoveable property of one person is by act of parties or operation of law made security for the payment of money to another, and the transaction does not amount to a mortgage, the latter person is said to have a charge on the property; and all the provisions hereinbefore contained which apply to a simple mortgage shall, so far as may be, apply to such charge.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Nothing in this section applies to the charge of a trustee on the trust-property for expenses properly incurred in the execution of his trust, and, save as otherwise expressly provided by any law for the time being in force, no charge shall be enforced against any property in the hands of a person to whom such property has been transferred for consideration and without notice of the charge. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	No merger in case of subsequent encumbrance

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    101. Any mortgagee of, or person having a charge upon, immoveable property, or any transferee from such mortgagee or charge-holder, may purchase or otherwise acquire the rights in the property of the mortgagor or owner, as the case may be, without thereby causing the mortgage or charge to be merged as between himself and any subsequent mortgagee of, or person having a subsequent charge upon, the same property; and no such subsequent mortgagee or charge-holder shall be entitle to foreclose or sell such property without redeeming the prior mortgage or charge, or otherwise than subject thereto. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            Notice and Tender

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Service or tender on or to agent

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    102. Where the person on or to whom any notice or tender is to be served or made under this Chapter does not reside in the district in which the mortgaged property or some part thereof is situate, service or tender on or to an agent holding a general power-of-attorney from such person or otherwise duly authorised to accept such service or tender shall be deemed sufficient.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Where no person or agent on whom such notice should be served can be found or is known to the person required to serve the notice, the latter person may apply to any Court in which a suit might be brought for redemption of the mortgaged property, and such Court shall direct in what manner such notice shall be served, and any notice served in compliance with such direction shall be deemed sufficient:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that, in the case of a notice required by section 83, in the case of a deposit, the application shall be made to the Court in which the deposit has been made.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Where no person or agent to whom such tender should be made can be found or is known to the person desiring to make the tender, the latter person may deposit in any Court in which a suit might be brought for redemption of the mortgaged property the amount sought to be tendered, and such deposit shall have the effect of a tender of such amount. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Notice, etc., to or by person incompetent to contract

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    103. Where, under the provisions of this Chapter, a notice is to be served on or by, or a tender or deposit made or accepted or taken out of Court by, any person incompetent to contract, such notice may be served on or by, or tender or deposit made, accepted or taken, by the legal curator of the property of such person; but where there is no such curator, and it is requisite or desirable in the interests of such person that a notice should be served or a tender or deposit made under the provisions of this Chapter, application may be made to any Court in which a suit might be brought for the redemption of the mortgage to appoint<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>a guardian ad litem for the purpose of serving or receiving service of such notice, or making or accepting such tender, or making or taking out of Court such deposit, and for the performance of all consequential acts which could or ought to be done by such person if he were competent to contract; and the provisions of Order XXXII in the First Schedule to the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a> shall, so far as may be, apply to such application and to the parties thereto and to the guardian appointed thereunder. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Power to make rules

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    104. The  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œSupreme Courtâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œHigh Courtâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >30</a></sup></span></span>[Supreme Court] may, from time to time, make rules consistent with this Act for carrying out, in itself and in the Courts of Civil Judicature subject to its superintendence, the provisions contained in this Chapter. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® V

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                OF LEASES OF IMMOVEABLE PROPERTY

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	â€œLeaseâ€ defined	

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    105. A lease of immoveable property is a transfer of a right to enjoy such property, made for a certain time, express or implied, or in perpetuity, in consideration of a price paid or promised, or of money, a share of crops, service or any other thing of value, to be rendered periodically or on specified occasions to the transferor by the transferee, who accepts the transfer on such terms.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            "Lessor", "lessee", "premium" and "rent" defined

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    The transferor is called the lessor, the transferee is called the lessee, the price is called the premium, and the money, share, service or other thing to be so rendered is called the rent.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Duration of certain leases in absence of written contract or local usage

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    106. In the absence of a contract or local law or usage to the contrary, a lease of immoveable property for agricultural or manufacturing purposes shall be deemed to be a lease from year to year, terminable, on the part of either lessor or lessee, by six months' notice expiring with the end of a year of the tenancy; and a lease of immoveable property for any other purpose shall be deemed to be a lease from month to month, terminable, on the part of either lessor or lessee, by fifteen days' notice expiring with the end of a month of the tenancy.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Every notice under this section must be in writing signed by or on behalf of the person giving it, and either be sent by post to the party who is intended to be bound by it or be tendered or delivered personally to such party, or to one of his family or servants at his residence, or (if such tender or delivery is not practicable) affixed to a conspicuous part of the property. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Leases how made

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    107. A lease of immoveable property from year to year, or for any term exceeding one year, or reserving a yearly rent, can be made only by a registered instrument.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>All other leases of immoveable property may be made either by a registered instrument or by oral agreement accompanied by delivery of possession.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Where a lease of immoveable property is made by a registered instrument, such instrument or, where there are more instruments than one, each such instrument shall be executed by both the lessor and the lessee:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that the Government may, from time to time, by notification in the official Gazette, direct that leases of immoveable property, other than leases from year to year, or for any term exceeding one year, or reserving a yearly rent, or any class of such leases, may be made by unregistered instrument or by oral agreement without delivery of possession. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Rights and liabilities of lessor and lessee

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    108. In the absence of a contract or local usage to the contrary, the lessor and the lessee of immoveable property, as against one another, respectively, possess the rights and are subject to the liabilities mentioned in the rules next following, or such of them are applicable to the property leased:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(A) Rights and Liabilities of the Lessor	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	The lessor is bound to disclose to the lessee any material defect in the property, with reference to its intended use, of which the former is and the latter is not aware, and which the latter could not with ordinary care discover:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	the lessor is bound on the lessee's request to put him in possession of the property:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	the lessor shall be deemed to contract with the lessee that, if the latter pays the rent reserved by the lease and performs the contracts binding on the lessee, he may hold the property during the time limited by the lease without interruption.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>The benefit of such contract shall be annexed to and go with the lessee's interest as such, and may be enforced by every person in whom that interest is for the whole or any part thereof from time to time vested.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(B) Rights and Liabilities of the Lessee	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	If during the continuance of the lease any accession is made to the property, such accession (subject to the law relating to alluvion for the time being in force) shall be deemed to be comprised in the lease:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	if by fire, tempest or flood, or violence of an army or of a mob or other irresistible force, any material part of the property be wholly destroyed or rendered substantially and permanently unfit for the purposes for which it was let, the lease shall, at the option of the lessee, be void:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that, if the injury be occasioned by the wrongful act or default of the lessee, he shall not be entitled to avail himself of the benefit of this provision:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	if the lessor neglects to make, within a reasonable time after notice, any repairs which he is bound to make to the property, the lessee may make the same himself, and deduct the expense of such repairs with interest from the rent, or otherwise recover it from the lessor:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(g)	if the lessor neglects to make any payment which he is bound to make, and which, if not make by him, is recoverable from the lessee or against the property, the lessee may make such payment himself, and deduct it with interest from the rent, or otherwise recover it from the lessor:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(h)	the lessee may even after the determination of the lease remove, at any time whilst he is in possession of the property leased but not afterwards all things which he has attached to the earth: provided he leaves the property in the state in which he received it:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(i)	when a lease of uncertain duration determines by any means except the fault of the lessee, he or his legal representative is entitled to all the crops planted or sown by the lessee and growing upon the property when the lease determines, and to free ingress and egress to gather and carry them:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(j)	the lessee may transfer absolutely or by way of mortgage or sub-lease the whole or any part of his interest in the property, and any transferee of such interest or part may again transfer it. The lessee shall not, by reason only of such transfer, cease to be subject to any of the liabilities attaching to the lease:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>		nothing in this clause shall be deemed to authorise a tenant having an un-transferable right of occupancy, the farmer of an estate in respect of which default has been made in paying revenue, or the lessee of an estate under the management of a Court of Wards, to assign his interest as such tenant, farmer or lessee:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(k)	the lessee is bound to disclose to the lessor any fact as to the nature or extent of the interest which the lessee is about to take, of which the lessee is, and the lessor is not, aware, and which materially increases the value of such interest:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(l)	the lessee is bound to pay or tender, at the proper time and place, the premium or rent to the lessor or his agent in this behalf:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(m)	the lessee is bound to keep, and on the termination of the lease to restore, the property in as good condition as it was in at the time when he was put in possession, subject only to the changes caused by reasonable wear and tear or irresistible force, and to allow the lessor and his agents, at all reasonable times during  the  term,  to  enter  upon  the  property  and 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	inspect the condition thereof and give or leave notice of any defect in such condition, and, when such defect has been caused by any act or default on the part of the lessee, his servants or agents, he is bound to make it good within three months after such notice has been given or left:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(n)	if the lessee becomes aware of any proceeding to recover the property or any part thereof, or of any encroachment made upon, or any interference with, the lessor's rights concerning such property, he is bound to give, with reasonable diligence, notice thereof to the lessor:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(o)	the lessee may use the property and its products (if any) as a person of ordinary prudence would use them if they were his own; but he must not use, or permit another to use, the property for a purpose other than that for which it was leased, or fell or sell timber, pull down or damage buildings belonging to the lessor, or work mines or quarries not open when the lease was granted, or commit any other act which is destructive or permanently injurious thereto:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(p)	he must not, without the lessor's consent, erect on the property any permanent structure, except for agricultural purposes:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(q)	on the determination of the lease, the lessee is bound to put the lessor into possession of the property.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Rights of lessorâ€™s transferee

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    109. If the lessor transfers the property leased, or any part thereof, or any part of his interest therein, the transferee, in the absence of a contract to the contrary, shall possess all the rights, and, if the lessee so elects, be subject to all the liabilities of the lessor as to the property or part transferred so long as he is the owner of it; but the lessor shall not, by reason only of such transfer, cease to be subject to any of the liabilities imposed upon him by the lease, unless the lessee elects to treat the transferee as the person liable to him:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that the transferee is not entitled to arrears of rent due before the transfer, and that, if the lessee, not having reason to believe that such transfer has been made, pays rent to the lessor, the lessee shall not be liable to pay such rent over again to the transferee.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>The lessor, the transferee and the lessee may determine what proportion of the premium or rent reserved by the lease is payable in respect of the part so transferred, and, in case they disagree, such determination may be made by any Court having jurisdiction to entertain a suit for the possession of the property leased. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Exclusion of day on which term commences	

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    110. Where the time limited by a lease of immoveable property is expressed as commencing from a particular day, in computing that time such day shall be excluded. Where no day of commencement is named, the time so limited begins from the making of the lease.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Duration of lease for a year

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    Where the time so limited is a year or a number of years, in the absence of an express agreement to the contrary, the lease shall last during the whole anniversary of the day from which such time commences.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Option to determine lease

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    Where the time so limited is expressed to be terminable before its expiration, and the lease omits to mention at whose option it is so terminable, the lessee, and not the lessor, shall have such option.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Determination of lease

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    111. A lease of immoveable property determines-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	by efflux of the time limited thereby:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	where such time is limited conditionally on the happening of some event - by the happening of such event:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	where the interest of the lessor in the property terminates on, or his power to dispose of the same extends only to, the happening of any event - by the happening of such event:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	in case the interests of the lessee and the lessor in the whole of the property become vested at the same time in one person in the same right:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	by express surrender; that is to say, in case the lessee yields up his interest under the lease to the lessor, by mutual agreement between them:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	by implied surrender:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(g)	by forfeiture; that is to say, (1) in case the lessee breaks an express condition which provides that on breach thereof the lessor may re-enter; or (2) in case the lessee renounces his character as such by setting up a title in a third person or by claiming title in himself; or (3) the lessee is adjudicated an insolvent and the lease provides that the lessor may re-enter on the happening of such event; and in any of these cases the lessor or his transferee gives notice in writing to the lessee of his intention to determine the lease:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(h)	on the expiration of a notice to determine the lease, or to quit, or of intention to quit, the property leased, duly given by one party to the other.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Illustration of clause (f)	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>A lessee accepts from his lessor a new lease of the property leased, to take effect during the continuance of the existing lease. This is an implied surrender of the former lease, and such lease determines thereupon.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Waiver of forfeiture

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    112. A forfeiture under section 111, clause (g), is waived by acceptance of rent which has become due since the forfeiture, or by distress for such rent, or by any other act on the part of the lessor showing an intention to treat the lease as subsisting:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that the lessor is aware that the forfeiture has been incurred:<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided also that, where rent is accepted after the institution of a suit to eject the lessee on the ground of forfeiture, such acceptance is not a waiver. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Waiver of notice to quit

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    113. A notice given under section 111, clause (h), is waived, with the express or implied consent of the person to whom it is given, by any act on the part of the person giving it showing an intention to treat the lease as subsisting.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Illustrations<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) A, the lessor, gives B, the lessee, notice to quit the property leased. The notice expires. B tenders, and A accepts, rent which has become due in respect of the property since the expiration of the notice. The notice is waived.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b) A, the lessor, gives B, the lessee, notice to quit the property leased. The notice expires, and B remains in possession. A gives to B as lessee a second notice to quit. The first notice is waived. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Relief against forfeiture for non-payment of rent

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    114. Where a lease of immoveable property has determined by forfeiture for non-payment of rent, and the lessor sues to eject the lessee, if, at the hearing of the suit, the lessee pays or tenders to the lessor the rent in arrear, together with interest thereon and his full costs of the suit, or gives such security as the Court thinks sufficient for making such payment within fifteen days, the Court may, in lieu of making a decree for ejectment pass an order relieving the lessee against the forfeiture; and thereupon the lessee shall hold the property leased as if the forfeiture had not occurred. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Relief against forfeiture in certain other cases

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    <span class='footnote'  title='Section 114A was inserted by section 58 of the Transfer of Property (Amendment) Act, 1929 (Act No. XX of 1929)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >31</a></sup></span></span>[114A. Where a lease of immoveable property has determined by forfeiture for a breach of an express condition which provides that on breach thereof the lessor may re-enter, no suit for ejectment shall lie unless and until the lessor has served on the lessee a notice in writing-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	specifying the particular breach complained of; and 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	if the breach is capable of remedy, requiring the lessee to remedy the breach;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>and the lessee fails, within a reasonable time from the date of the service of the notice, to remedy the breach, if it is capable of remedy.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Nothing in this section shall apply to an express condition against the assigning, under-letting, parting with the possession, or disposing, of the property leased, or to an express condition relating to forfeiture in case of non-payment of rent.]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Effect of surrender and forfeiture on under-leases

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    115. The surrender, express or implied, of a lease of immoveable property does not prejudice an under -lease of the property or any part thereof previously granted by the lessee, on terms and conditions substantially the same (except as regards the amount of rent) as those of the original lease; but, unless the surrender is made for the purpose of obtaining a new lease, the rent payable by, and the contracts binding on, the under-lessee shall be respectively payable to and enforceable by the lessor. 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>The forfeiture of such a lease annuls all such under -leases except where such forfeiture has been procured by the lessor in fraud of the under-lessees, or relief against the forfeiture is granted under section 114.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Effect of holding over

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    116. If a lessee or under-lessee of property remains in possession thereof after the determination of the lease granted to the lessee, and the lessor or his legal representative accepts rent from the lessee or under-lessee, or otherwise assents to his continuing in possession, the lease is, in the absence of an agreement to the contrary, renewed from year to year, or from month to month, according to the purpose for which the property is leased, as specified in section 106.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Illustrations	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a) A lets a house to B for five years. B underlets the house to C at a monthly rent of Tk. 100. The five years expire, but C continues in possession of the house and pays the rent to A. C's lease is renewed from month to month.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> (b) A lets a farm to B for the life of C. C dies, but B continues in possession with A's assent. B's lease is renewed from year to year.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Exemption of leases for agricultural purposes

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    117. None of the provisions of this Chapter apply to leases for agricultural purposes, except in so far as the Government may, by notification published in the official Gazette, declare all or any of such provisions to be so applicable in the case of all or any of such leases, together with, or subject to, those of the local law, if any, for the time being in force.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Such notification shall not take effect until the expiry of six months from the date of its publication.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® VI

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                OF EXCHANGES

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	â€œExchangeâ€ defined

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    118. When two persons mutually transfer the ownership of one thing for the ownership of another, neither thing or both things being money only, the transaction is called an â€œexchangeâ€.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>A transfer of property in completion of an exchange can be made only in manner provided of the transfer of such property by sale. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Right of party deprived of thing received in exchange

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    119. If any party to an exchange or any person claiming through or under such party is by reason of any defect in the title of the other party deprived of the thing or any part of the thing received by him in exchange, then, unless a contrary intention appears from the terms of the exchange, such other party is liable to him or any person claiming through or under him for loss caused thereby, or at the option of the person so deprived, for the return of the thing transferred, if still in the possession of such other party or his legal representative or a transferee from him without consideration. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Rights and liabilities of parties

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    120. Save as otherwise provided in this Chapter, each party has the rights and is subject to the liabilities of a seller as to that which he gives, and has the rights and is subject to the liabilities of a buyer as to that which he takes. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Exchange of money

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    121. On an exchange of money, each party thereby warrants the genuineness of the money given by him. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® VII

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                OF GIFTS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	â€œGiftâ€ defined	

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    122. â€œGiftâ€ is the transfer of certain existing moveable or immoveable property made voluntarily and without consideration, by one person, called the donor, to another, called the donee, and accepted by or on behalf of the donee.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            Acceptance when to be made

                            
                            
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    Such acceptance must be made during the lifetime of the donor and while he is still capable of giving.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>If the donee dies before acceptance, the gift is void.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Transfer how effected

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    123. For the purpose of making a gift of immoveable property, the transfer must be effected by a registered instrument signed by or on behalf of the donor, and attested by at least two witnesses.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='New paragraph was inserted by section 7 of the Transfer of Property (Amendment) Act, 2004 (Act No. XXVI of 2004)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >32</a></sup></span></span>[Notwithstanding anything contained in any other law for the time being in force, a heba under Muhammadan law shall be deemed to be a gift of immoveable property for the aforesaid purpose.]<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>For the purpose of making a gift of moveable property, the transfer may be effected either by a registered instrument signed as aforesaid or by delivery.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Such delivery may be made in the same way as goods sold may be delivered

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Gift of existing and future property

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
